intro: Trianosperma trifoliolatum, commonly known as the three-leaf fern, is a perennial plant characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and has a rhizomatous growth habit. Its fronds are typically leathery and dark green, with a serrated edge. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
